byline.contributor: Gardiner Harris, Jennifer Steinhauer and Emmarie Huetteman contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The emergency financing is likely to face a challenge in the House, where hard-line conservatives have balked at new government spending.

headline.print_headline: Senate Nears Deal for at Least $1.1 Billion to Fight Zika, but House Is Wary
headline.main: Senate Nears Deal for at Least $1.1 Billion to Fight Zika Virus

snippet: The emergency financing is likely to face a challenge in the House, where hard-line conservatives have balked at new government spending.
abstract: Senate negotiators establish outlines of agreement that would provide around $1.1 billion in emergency financing to combat Zika virus; Democrats accuse Republicans of moving too slowly to approve funds and continue push for greater $1.9 billion sum.
